reviewText: Very good case for Astrology as a true science. This DVD takes astrology out of the woo-woo fortune-telling realm and places it firmly alongside quantum physics and other legitimate sciences. Mr. Levine clearly shows with outstanding computer animations how astrology is based on a solar and galactic clock, one that runs on cosmic time, i.e., one that is so slow we must look at it's influences in terms of centuries and mellenia of time, not days, years or even decades.  He shows historical events, both human and astronomical over the past 5000 years, which consistently align with particular planetary confluences, and how astrology can be used, not to predict the future, but just as our current time-keeping clocks, to help us understand the times we are in. Recommended for anyone who does not believe in or understand the basic concepts of Astrology, but wants to explore.
summary: Very good case for Astrology as a true science.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD has however many minutes of Rick sitting in front of a fireplace telling us an exhaustive list of events that happened throughout history at the time of the Pluto/Jupiter conjunct/opposition and the Pluto/Uranus conjunct/opposition. The same cartoon of Pluto and Jupiter spins around over and over and over again when we are not looking at Rick in front of the fireplace. The only decent aspect of the DVD was a beautiful but repetitive graphic image of the planets orbiting the sun. This is not an instructive astrology DVD - it is an advertorial about how astrology is useful in predicting world events.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I enjoyed and appreciated seeing this done on dvd. I am an older astrologer and greatly enjoyed this presentation of some interesting views,facts and pictures. I plan to share this with a group. It is a good perspective to always keep in mind.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first half of this dvd is a gem.  The second half - yes, it does have a lot of pretty boring Rick talking about world events as they pertain to Pluto.  My husband is fairly new to astrology with only a basic understanding - he loved the first half, and hated the second.I have studied astrology for years.  I enjoyed the first half better than the second, but I did feel the second half gave me insight.  It was just that it was less of a multi-media presentation (like the first half)and more of a boring lecture.I do think this is a good dvd to watch if you want to learn more about how most of us believes 'it works.'
summary: Watch the first half if you are new to astrology
Title: N/A

reviewText: We humans are good at finding patterns and correlations between different events and/or phenomena, and from these patterns and correlations we come up with theories. And since we have always tried to make sense of the different events that have happened throughout history, it "appears" to us we have found the patterns and correlations in the heavens. Therefore, the theory goes that the positions of the Moon, Sun, and other planets affect the course of events here on earth. Unfortunately, Astrology is a theory that is so general we cannot use it to predict exact events, which makes it border towards superstition.On the surface Astrology looks promising because planet alignments happen in intervals from several years to several decades to hundreds of years, which mimics the periods of major historical events that have happened here on earth. But this is the only correlation between the two events (planet alignment intervals - historical events). Therefore, Astrology undermines every other reasonable explanation for the cause of events except for planet alignments. It undermines the study of History, with all its authentic texts and stories that make sense. A true historian who has done his homework will understand why such events have happened in that particular time. Also, a true historian will have a good vision of the future and events that can and will happen.It is easy to assign important events that correspond with planet alignments because as Rick Levine put it himself:"There's always something that isn't the most obvious event that becomes quite important"Indeed, almost all past events are important because of the ripple effect, and any small event in the past gets amplified with time. I personally find Ufology much more interesting than Astrology even though many will consider Astrology more credible. Ufology has much more scientific explanation to do instead of relying on one theme "planet alignments".But I will give credit to Rick Levine for inventing such beautiful explanations of matter and waves. 3 stars for this one:"Matter is light that has somehow trapped itself into holding patterns tied itself up into knots. We as crystalline structures are in fact light energy that is tied gravitationally into patterns that have holding patterns that in fact respond to the larger gravitational or electromagnetic pull of the planets. This is why Astrology works; you see planets are electromagnetic vibrations".
summary: Do you believe in Astrology or Coincidence?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Well title sound promising. Some explanations of major event looked like they match to some stars alignment until Mr Levine started talk about events what I know a little better such as two leaders on different sides of front line in World War II. So Mr Levine pointed at year 1931 saying that at this year two leaders (mentioned below) "..coming to power" because of Saturn - Pluto alignment along with Cancer zodiac sign. Here we go. Cancer 21 June - 22 July has nothing to do with that two leaders or their career. Stalin was born on Dec. 21, 1879, Hitler - April 20th 1889. Now about magic 1931. Here is a facts:" ... By 1921 Adolf Hitler had virtually secured total control of the Nazi party.March 1933. The powers of legislation was taken away from the Reichstag and transferred to Hitler's cabinet for a period of four years. He was appointed Chancellor of Germany on January 30th 1933.Stalin was elected General Secretary of the Party in 1922, and began to increase his personal power. By 1930, he stood alone atop the Party and the Soviet Union... "So as you can see there is not major event on 1931 regarding to these persons.I'm not going to dig up the other facts. It just enough to say that for me now astrology looks like an edge smearing of accuracy. However the stars has influence on us. For example there was Russian astronomer Anatoly Dyakov (1911--1985) who by studding the Sun activities predicted the weather on Earth with precise accuracy predicting in the summer of 1972 on the Central Russian elevation fall great dryness and frost in France. Here is some facts of underestimating the skeptics:  Paris, France. Reciprocal telegram: To [a]. [V]. [Dyakov], Temir Tau, the USSR (in sufficient- after all the lenient tone): "Thanks for the dispatch, and in particular for the urgency. We already dress into the warm mantle" (allegedly, ha ha, healthily frightened us you, Russian associate!). On December 21, 1978 - very beginning of the promised By [dyakovym] unprecedented frost in France. Strong temperature drop in Europe produced a sharp increase in the expenditure of electric power... Many plants and factories ended work... Trains froze... Damage is evaluated at four billion French Francs.Well I can't recall that Mr Levine mentioned these events.In my opinion there is a connection between us and stars. It just looks like astrologists can't put all ends together to give accurate picture of this connection.As for DVD itself I can't give more stars because there is no chapters so you can't jump to the next episode if you  want to continue to watch  it next time, there is not background music, there is only one person constantly talking, there is not enough illustrations and animations, there are a lot dates which Mr Levine trying to squeeze in to Saturn - Pluto alignment.
